dmca.title: Adobe asks Google to take down blog that allegedly provides software cracks
dmca.body:
Adobe Systems Incorporated 
[Private]
San Francisco, CA 94103 
Phone: [Private} 
Fax: [Private]

Date: 1/22/07
To: Google
Fax Number: [Private]
From: Chris Stickle 
Regarding: http://filenetworkslive.blogspot.com/2007/01/adobe-indesign-cs3-keygen.html
No. of Pages: 1 (including cover) 

Dear Google, 

The website, http://filenetworkslive.blogspot.com/2007/01/adobe-indesign-cs3-keygen.html hosted on your network contains items that infringe upon Adobe Systems' copyrighted software. Most notably, the site offers downloads/cracks for Adobe Creative Suite 3.
 
I have a good faith belief that use of the copyrighted infringing web pages is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law. I swear, under penalty of perjury, that the information in the notification is accurate and that I am the copyright owner or am authorized to act on behalf of allegedly infringed.

If there is anything else you need or if you have any questions, feel free to contact me anytime.

Thanks,

Chris Stickle 
Enforcement Manager Anti-Piracy 
Adobe Systems 
[Private] 
San Francisco, CA 94103 
[Private}
[Private]
